titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 781: Statutes and constitution of the Ordre de Saint-Michel

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 781: Statutes and constitution of the Ordre de Saint-Michel are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: The date of the order's founding, 1469, appears on f. 33v; on the same page, a slightly later note refers to the position of the prévost maistre des ceremonies, which was instituted in 1476.
f. 1r: "[text] Loys par la grace de dieu roy de France. Savoir faisonz a touz presens et advenir ..."

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Statutes and constitution of the Ordre de Saint-Michel, detailing the responsibilities of the knights of the order, such as attendance at an annual meeting on the Feast of St. Michael (September 29).

msItem.title: Statutes and constitution of the Ordre de Saint-Michel

supportDesc.extent: 45 leaves : 201 x 144 (150 x 92) mm. bound to 209 x 155 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, ii + 45 + i; [1-45]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 22 long lines; frame-ruled in ink.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script.

decoDesc.decoNote: 4-line illuminated initial (f. 1r), gold letter on a red square decorated with gray (once silver?) vines and flowers.
